entry.title: RAINFALL WARNING , Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 4:28 PM NST Saturday 04 March 2023

entry.title: SNOWFALL WARNING , Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 4:21 PM NST Saturday 04 March 2023

entry.title: Current Conditions: Mostly Cloudy, -8.1°C
entry.summary:
Observed at: Mary's Harbour 4:30 PM NST Saturday 04 March 2023
Condition: Mostly Cloudy
Temperature: -8.1°C
Pressure: 100.2 kPa
Visibility: 16.1 km
Humidity: 69 %
Wind Chill: -13
Dewpoint: -12.8°C
Wind: N 9 km/h
Air Quality Health Index: N/A

entry.title: Saturday night: Snow mixed with ice pellets. Temperature rising to zero by morning.
entry.summary: Cloudy. Snow beginning this evening. Snow mixed with ice pellets before morning. Blowing snow over exposed areas overnight. Snow and ice pellet amount 10 to 15 cm. Wind becoming northwest 30 km/h gusting to 50 except gusting to 70 along parts of the coast near midnight. Wind becoming north 20 gusting to 40 before morning. Temperature rising to zero by morning. Wind chill minus 20 this evening. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Saturday 04 March 2023

entry.title: Sunday: Rain at times heavy or snow. High plus 2.
entry.summary: Snow or ice pellets changing to rain at times heavy in the morning. Rainfall amount 20 to 30 mm. Wind north 20 km/h gusting to 40 becoming northeast 30 gusting to 50 in the morning. High plus 2. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Saturday 04 March 2023

entry.title: Sunday night: Rain at times heavy. Temperature steady near plus 2.
entry.summary: Rain at times heavy except snow at times heavy inland and over higher terrain. Rainfall amount 20 to 30 mm except snowfall amount 20 cm inland and over higher terrain. Wind northeast 40 km/h gusting to 60. Temperature steady near plus 2. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Saturday 04 March 2023
